properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain will continue to fall in the Timmins area as well as areas to the north. After a heavy downpour of showers earlier, moderate to light rain will continue to fall over the next 24 hours. An additional 20 to 30 mm is expected to fall over this period along with local thunderstorms tonight and Friday afternoon. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-29T18:09:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-29T02:10:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3095506556.2020
Area: Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake, Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very warm and humid weather continues. Time span: this evening, tonight, and continuing Friday in some areas Locations: central and northern New Brunswick. Minimum temperature tonight: 18 to 20 degrees C Maximum temperature Friday: 30 degrees C (Humidex 35 to 38) Remarks: Warm temperatures will continue tonight and Friday. Overnight temperatures tonight are expected to be 18 C to 20 C. Friday temperatures are expected to range from 28 to 30 C over much of the province. Temperatures will be cooler Saturday as a trough tracks across the province. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-29T17:01:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-29T01:02:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2823960571.2020
Area: Fredericton and Southern York County, Oromocto and Sunbury County, Woodstock and Carleton County, Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Kent County, Kouchibouguac National Park, Bathurst and Chaleur Region, Miramichi and area

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable this afternoon for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very warm and humid weather will continue today. Time span: today Locations: central and northeastern New Brunswick. Maximum temperature today: 30 degrees with humidex of 36 to 38 Remarks: Today will be the last day with highs in the 30s and humidex values in the high 30s. Rain showers and cloud cover will give cooler daytime highs on Saturday, with a significant airmass change coming later this weekend as winds shift to northwesterly. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-30T04:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-29T14:05:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2177196321.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong thunderstorms late Saturday followed by significant rainfall on Sunday. A significant change in the weather will arrive on Saturday as a low pressure system enters B.C. from Washington State. Ahead of the low Saturday afternoon, atmospheric conditions are potentially conducive to strong thunderstorms with frequent lightning and very strong wind gusts. Heavy rain may accompany these storms. Widespread rainfall will accompany the low pressure system Saturday night and Sunday which may strain local rivers. Environment and Climate Change Canada meteorologists will continue to monitor the situation as the weekend approaches. For more information on river flow forecasts, and flood warning and advisories, please visit the BC River Forecast Centre website at http://bcrfc.env.gov.bc.ca/warnings/index.htm ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-30T04:10:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-29T12:11:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0360020639.2020
Area: South Thompson, Nicola, Similkameen, North Okanagan - including Vernon, Central Okanagan - including Kelowna, South Okanagan - including Penticton, Shuswap, Arrow Lakes - Slocan Lake, Boundary, West Kootenay, Kootenay Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Dense fog developed last evening along the north and eastern shorelines of Lake Superior. Fog will persist throughout through the early morning hours but is expected to gradually dissipate later this morning as a drier northerly flow enters the region. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-29T20:53:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-29T09:20:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3930846370.2020
